job_title: Network Engineer in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: I love working at SU (I'm a alumni) you get exposed to all vendor types, meet different people and backgrounds but mostly the work day is different everyday. New projects, departmental projects that leads to additional new skills for yourself. Definitely love working with students and giving back.
cons:
Sometimes the cultural doesn't like change which makes it hard for new project implementations. 
I had 6 job titles but did the same job with more work but never got any additional pay. Money only goes to those they "like", lots of nepotism and no gender equality. I worked there for over 10 years and had 2 management changes in the last 4 years that equal more turnovers within just my department.

review_title: Good people but very political environment (SUNO)
job_title: Coordinator in New Orleans, LA
pros: Compensation was fair.  Work hours were relatively normal - 8-5, M-F.  Paid holidays, good retirement and benefits. There are a lot of very hard working and dedicated people who believe in educating those with challenging backgrounds.
cons: There are some weird culture wars going on there between the SUNO insiders, who graduated from SUNO and have only ever worked at SUNO, and the outsiders who have risen to the top administrative ranks.  Sometimes it rises to the level of animosity, but mostly the university is just held back by the notion that "We do it this way because this is how it has always been done."  Also, the budget is shoddy and that takes it's toll on the availability of office and classroom supplies and technology.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: As a graduate of Southern University, I chose to come back to work because I wanted to give back to the institution that gave me so much.
cons: I had hoped, however, that in the years since my graduation things would have gotten better. Unfortunately, it has not; in fact, it has gotten worse. Everyone who attempts to make changes for the better either is dismissed or heads for greener pastures. Sad to say, I am hoping to count myself among the latter - I am planning my exit as I type this.

job_title: in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: Know that you are contributing to the youth of today and the future of tomorrow.  A chance to learn one limitation when dealing with uncooperative people.
cons: Training and job guidelines presented were completely ignored.  They were not followed by or supervisors or previous employees.  Nepotism at its worst.  Being contrary to poor work ethic was criticized.

job_title: in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: Great flexibility, great boss, I enjoyed the time I had working under my boss and getting paid for something I would have done freely
cons: No structure, sometimes I would get paid late, you have to call and go all around the campus just to find the correct person to get your pay, paperwork is a mess, the whole process of finalizing employment was messy

review_title: My experience at Southern University Baton Rouge Campus has been rewarding to work with some of the best students.
job_title: Chief Data Officer in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: I have been able to learn many essential skills with the software tools I have utilized throughout my career. Co-workers and executive directors were the best component of this organization.
cons: This position is becoming boring, the cubicle atmosphere makes it hard to concentrate on the daily tasks afforded me to complete. Advancement opportunities are slim to none for some qualified employees.

job_title: Mechanical Engineer in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: I receive a paycheck most of the time.  It is decent experience and it looks good to be affiliated with the university.
cons: Dealing with HR has been a hassle.  Dealing with other managers and directors can be very disorganized and most don't want to admit with they are in over their heads.

job_title: Program Coordinator in Baton Rouge, LA
pros: I loved working for SUBR. They treated you like family, and I learned a lot in 3 years that has helped me in my career thus far. I appreciate every moment at SUBR.
cons: The politics at the time was something that I did not understand. I had to learn something once I left, but it was one of the things that I did not like at the time.

review_title: One of the best professional environment I have worked at.
